website_summaries.verdict: AKG's K 350 earphones bring high-quality audio performance to a very affordable price range, and throws in iPhone controls for added value.
pros: High quality audio output for the price
cons: Minor distortion at maximum volume on deep bass tracks
Color options are a bit offbeat, and not for everyone

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed and felt deceived with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: "Quote: "AKG K350 is compatible with any smartphone. You can conveniently make hands-free calls and adjust volume remotely". But the volume control buttons are not working with both my smartphones. I chose to buy this product is because of the compatibility as mentioned, unfortunately it is not true. Online customers can only rely on product specifications to decide on the purchase, but what was written is not genuine. I am very disappointed and felt deceived with this purchase. Please advise solution. Thank you."
customer_reviews.author: Mike Chan

customer_reviews.title: Returned.
customer_reviews.text: I have a very big issue with earphones with different sized earbuds. I did not like these at all, none of the sizes stayed in my ear, and they sounded worse than my apple iphone 5 earbuds. I would stick with the original ones as they are less expensive and have a better quality sound than these in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed after reading all the great reviews at Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Frankly, I was disappointed after reading all the great reviews at Amazon, that I bought two thinking it was a sure thing. But althought the mid and highs were clear, the bass was very disappointingly thin that it hardly gave justice to full range material. I've had $20 Sony earphones that sounded much better, even Philipps ones. I should have stuck to them. They're simply unused today as I keep enjoying my old Sonys.
customer_reviews.author: Irene D

customer_reviews.title: Sound is good, clear toned sound
customer_reviews.text: Sound is good, clear toned sound. but have lower bass and if your ear canal's small, maybe hard to put your ear it. because headphone itself is not small. Also volume up &down button not workink on android phones.
customer_reviews.author: darbelux

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of in-ear headphones. controls and mic make it very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.text: Great sound! The mids seem to lag behind a bit, but the highs and lows are very good. Especially when hearing some heavy bass stuff like Hip Hop, House or Electro you'll notice the perfect lows! Definitely recommended! If it would have been possible a would have given 4.5 out of 5 stars cuz of the mids.
customer_reviews.author: PhilMyday

customer_reviews.title: Cord Broken on receipt
customer_reviews.text: The look great and I wish I had an opportunity to hear them but the cord was broken or cut when I opened the package. The broken cord probably had something to do with the ridiculous obnoxious retail display package.
customer_reviews.author: Who Knew

customer_reviews.title: good earphone made for classic music
customer_reviews.text: great earphones a little on the brite side tried to ajuste with EQ but couldn't find a good balance so turned of EQ, I listen to all types of music but they sound excelent with classic music my guess they were design with type a music, I wear earphones all day at work and this buds fit good they were comfortable, one complain I have is to forward a song you need double click on the pause so if not done wright you end up just pausing perfer to forward using volume button.
customer_reviews.author: raulndmx

customer_reviews.title: Not too expensive, but still sound really great
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something not too expensive, but still sounds really great, and I found just that. The mic works well(i'm heard clearly).
customer_reviews.author: assaf amgar

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great!  Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: Loved the phones, great sound! But it only lasted seven weeks before I got a short in the mic. Bummer
customer_reviews.author: ja hizzle

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: Well, use it as a replacement for my iPhone Ear Pods. Not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sound from these buds. The sound distortion some have referenced is only noticed at high volume. Too high of a volume for me to be listening to. You will not be dissapionted with these buds. The sound is crisp & clean, great sounding high frequency and sweet low bass. I was concerned the bass wouldn't be hitten'. Well it hits just fine. I am satisfied and will be keeping them. Stop wasting $$ on cheap "throw away" ear buds. These may be the last pair you ever buy. Spend the extra $$, I paid $70, no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is good. The left bud would not stay in my ear even with the 3 different interchangeable buds.
customer_reviews.author: SHARON M, GASSON

customer_reviews.title: High quality based on value.
customer_reviews.text: This item based on its technical features is very good and without noise. Sound quality is very good and gives pleasure to Liston songs. Item has good performance. Only not recommended for phone since doesn't have Mic.
customer_reviews.author: Rominass

customer_reviews.title: Worked great with my iPod shuffle! Sounds better than any earbuds I've ever tried.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 3rd generation iPod shuffle which has no screen or control buttons on the actual device so I have to rely on the cord controls, these fit the bill perfectly. I listen to mostly rock and metal while working out with these and they sound amazing, bass isn't overbearing and the highs are crisp. Pros: -Sound quality is great -In line controls -3 different rubber ear cups for custom fit -Sale price :-) Cons: -Buttons take time to get used to -At very loud volumes they may be distorted. (And I mean REALLY loud volumes, I listen to my metal as loud as I can take w/o it hurting) -Controls don't work with my Galaxy s3.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Terrible sound! No bass and the highs are too pronounced
customer_reviews.text: The sound from this audiophiles is like a radio. I was hoping a high end sound, good mix between bass and mids. The result is quite disappointing. Had to change the covers in order to get a better result but I'm still disappointed with the sound I'm getting. Again, the bass is irregular and the mids are quite loud. Radio quality. Too bad for a 70 dollar product
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Cuentas

customer_reviews.title: The best in-ear headphones I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 different versions of Beats headphones -- because none has tips that fit and one has tips that like to separate from the earphones. The AKG's have rounded tips that work well in either ear and give well-balanced, crisp tones. I plan to replace my other Beats headsets so I can have one to work out; one for daily use; and one for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Harold D

customer_reviews.title: A handy device
customer_reviews.text: The ear buds with microphone work well and allow me to use my iPhone4S hands off for longer conference calling. Unlike the ear buds and microphone provided by Apple, this set of ear buds actually fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Supancich

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I was looking forward to hearing these earphones when I purchased them. Well, after trying to burn them in a little, I have given up. Even for 30 bucks, I expected better sounding cans. First, they have absolutely no bass. Secondly, they sound fuzzy, and they are not accurate, nor neutral to me.There is little mid range and the the highs....well..... I am sure that there are people whom like highs, but these sound like finger nails scratching on a chalk board. I am sure AKG makes better sounding earphones, but based on this purchase, I am going to think twice about spending money on this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: MLR13000

customer_reviews.title: wonderful
customer_reviews.text: They work as advertised and nary a complaint! Would buy again. Better Than Klipsch by far and at better cost.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Buy the Q460 these are overpriced and the sound quality is poor
customer_reviews.text: Not that great. In ear and over priced no bass response and hardly any mid range response. I would buy the AKG Q460 better sound.
customer_reviews.author: J English

customer_reviews.title: Great sound - comfortable wear
customer_reviews.text: These are very sturdy and powerful headphones. I never have to put the volume completely up because they are that loud. The music undertones comes through beautifully in different types of music, from jazz to house. They don't even fall out when I run! The play controls work great with iPhone and iPad. Really recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella Martz

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality for the money
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality was not what I had been used to with other similarly priced headphones. Materials were also flimsy and they only lasted 4 months with careful use.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah J Read

customer_reviews.title: Bad qualtiy
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is sub-optimal, especially for the price. The product must seems defective and non-genuine. I will not recommend anyone to buy.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Right way to wear the earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I bought it on sale at $40 and the performance is outstanding. The music is natural with bass and not metallic. If you would like to obtain the true performance, search on internet "Right way to wear earbuds". Wrong way to wear earbuds must lead to poor performance. The two important terms affect the sound quality are wearing method and the reproducing equipment. When I evaluate this headphone, I used tube pre-amplifier with tube headphone amplifier.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: These headhphones are amazing. The sound quality is great and they're pretty ...
customer_reviews.text: These headhphones are amazing. The sound quality is great and they're pretty noise cancelling. Also, they are extremely durable; I accidentally put them through the washer and dryer and they came out perfectly fine haha. In general, the quality of these are great.
customer_reviews.author: Mingjia

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in the sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these based on a "top 10" rating in PC Magazine's review of headsets. Wow, what a disappointment. The sound quality was lousy on my Ipod Classic- very tinny, treble-heavy. The original Apple ear buds that came with my Ipod actual sound much better. I'm returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Paul H

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Small ear tips are close to a medium in other brands but I just put my old tips on and it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Van Freeland

product_meta.title: AKG K350CRM Black, Silver
product_meta.description: K 350 ear canal headphones tip the scale at just 3 grams. Few headphones weigh less. But the sleek new K 350s deliver highly accurate, high-output sound that few headphones can match - at any weight. K 350s make an ideal upgrade to any portable player, including iPhone devices. Available in four fashionable colors
feature_bullets: Earphone Type Ear Coupling to the ear: Intr Aaural

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.0 out of 5 stars21 ratings3.0 out of 5 stars
